content.description: The crux is just at the beginning finding some good foothold and handholds. Once you pass this the route is mostly jugs and bomber holds all the way to the chains
content.protection: Bolts at the top with chains.
content.location: Farthest left on the main Rockwall, not the route on the smaller rock wall that is just left of the main wall

content.description: Fun route with some interesting liebacks and good heel hook opportunities. The crux is about 3/4 up the wall on the right crack as you have to switch over to a ledge to get to the finish.
content.protection: Bolts with about 1 foot of chains, will need webbing or a runner to prevent rope drag
content.location: Middle route on the main climbing wall just to the right of the scout wall. It does not have long chains so you will have to set up a anchor off of some short chains at the top of the route.

content.description: Good challenging route for newer climbers. Most struggle with starting out towards the beginning until about half way up the wall. Due to lack of good foothold. Was defintiley easier for taller climbers.
content.protection: Bolts with chains for edge protection
content.location: Just to the right of Hercules, has a pair of nice new silver chains to top rope off of.
